characters: THE COMMANDER AND TWO MOGADORIAN SOLDIERS
A PHOTOGRAPH OF SARAH AND JOHN
THE WOODEN FLOOR OPENS LIKE A ZIPPER

dialogues.speaker: A BILLION STARS
dialogues.text: pinprick the velvet-black sky that stretches over a vast sleeping jungle. A fingernail moon silvers the whispering canopy while gentle tendrils of steam rise. TITLE ON SCREEN: REPUBLIC OF CONGO, AFRICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DRIFTS ACROSS the eternity of treetops until it FI A BUNGALOW. It's 20x20 square, with a wraparound porch and simple woo shutters. The structure is hidden in a clearing that's be crudely hacked out of the sweaty wilderness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two beds draped in mosquito nets sit on opposite sides of space. A TEEN BOY sleeps in one and a MIDDLE-AGED MAN lie in the other. Their ebony skin glistens in the swampy hea The numbing THROB OF INSECTS fills the silence until THE DOOR SOFTLY RATTLES. The Teen's eyes fly open. Fear grips his face as he looks over at the Man, who is now upright and awake. They hold their breath, listening over the DRUMMING CHORUS. ANOTHER RATTLE. It's louder this time. Unmistakable. The Teen watches as the Man pulls a crystal-handled dagger from under his pil and stealthily creeps to the door. The Man cautiously lea in and peers through the bamboo slats. WHAT HE SEES: The empty porch. No sign of life. Relieved, he turns back, opens his mouth to speak when hi face contorts. He looks down and sees the tip of

dialogues.speaker: A SERRATED METAL BLADE
dialogues.text: protruding from his chest. As the sword is viciously protracted through the door, the Man meets the Teen's hau eyes and whispers his last, desperate word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Teen's naked feet pound the hot, wet earth as he spri through the maze of trees. Flecks of moonlight ricochet o the crystal pendant that dangles around his neck. He move impossibly fast. Faster than any human could.

dialogues.speaker: A MONSTROUS HOWL
dialogues.text: ECHOES as something otherworldly catches his scent and be thrashing in pursuit. The Teen's face tightens with dread and the SHOUTS of his pursuers hammer his ears. He doesn't look back, willing himself to survive. He race up a verge and fearlessly launches himself off the edge o

dialogues.speaker: A 100-FOOT-WIDE RAVINE
dialogues.text: GOD SHOT LOOKING DOWN as the Teen leaps across the abyss. kicks air as he arcs and finally touches down on the oppo lip. Chest heaving, he sees the hideous silhouette of A HULKING BEAST. It's called a Piken and skitters to a stop on the other s It utters a chilling BANSHEE WAIL of frustration. Relieve the Teen turns to make his escape when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wraps around his throat. He is effortlessly hoisted by a TOWERING MAN with skin as cold and pale as alabaster. THIS IS A MOGADORIAN. He wears the long red coat of a Commander. We catch the briefest glimpse of his cruel magenta eyes as they scan t geometric symbol engraved on the Teen's pendant. Silhouet against the giant jungle moon, he triumphantly raises A SWORD. Its serrated blade ignites with silver flame as it sweeps towards the Teen. The boy's DEATH CRY echoes as the CAMER ZEROES IN ON the pendant that glows brilliant-bright.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME SYMBOL.
dialogues.text: It glimmers to life on the ankle of another TEEN 10,000 m away. His name's DANIEL and he's in the middle of a wild ski race with TWO BUDDIES. TITLE ON SCREEN: BIG PINE KEY, FLORIDA, USA.

The trio crisscrosses the turquoise sea while a party rag on the beach. Daniel makes a kamikaze move, whips his jet ski past his opponents and victoriously pumps his fist. But his moment triumph is cut short. His face contorts in agony as he fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: searing into his skin. As he leans forward to grip his ankle, he cartwheels off the jet ski and viciously body-s across the water.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: LOOKING UP as Daniel crashes into view. Needles of light flicker from the symbol. It's cauterizing into his flesh like a brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel stumbles through the surf and collapses onto the s clutching his ankle. He rolls onto his side as a CROWD OF PARTYING TEENS gathers. A BLONDE GIRL leans down to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, what's wrong? Did you break your ankle? But as she turns him over, she sees the light leaking fro between his fingers and reels back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. He stares up into the crowd's fearful faces, then stagger his feet and takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The busy road runs parallel to an expanse of ancient pine Through the trees, we CATCH THE SHUTTER IMAGE of a figure outrunning the hurtling vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trees whip past as Daniel sprints down a sandy track. The pendant that knocks against his chest was carved by the s hand as the African Teen's, but the symbol is unique. He peels off to the right and bursts out onto a long drive.

dialogues.speaker: A STILT HOUSE
dialogues.text: sits at the end. It's cake-frosting pink and is built rig on the edge of a coral-white beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open and Daniel stands on the threshold. HENRI looks up from his bank of laptops that scroll with feeds. He is decades older than his suntanned face betray and you'd be way off if you guessed his accent was French

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number 3 is dead. Henri's eyes narrow with urgency. He is immediately on hi feet, he kneels at Daniel's side and studies the symbol o the teen's ankle. It has stopped glowing but is painfully raw. Directly below this fresh wound are TWO OTHER GEOMETRIC BRANDS. They are the same size, but each symbol is subtly differe Time has transformed them into raised, snake-smooth scars Henri's penetrating eyes look up at the shell-shocked tee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anybody else see this? OFF Daniel's panicked nod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: skitters across the ceiling, its glossy black eyes watch Daniel frantically stuffs his clothes into a duffel bag. walls are bare. No photos, no posters, no personality. Henri enters, holding a crate of computer cables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taillights in five minutes. What we can't carry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we burn. I know the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A BOX. It's exquisitely carved and inlaid with a intricate geometric design. Henri carefully hides it under the driver's seat of an ol Jeep Wagoneer. It's the kind with wooden trim. He looks a Daniel who feeds homework assignments into a roaring FIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go.

Daniel clicks the SIM card from his cell phone, snaps it two and drops it into the fire. Bitter, he takes one last look at the glittering azure sea, then climbs into the Je As the engine HUMS to life, CAMERA FOLLOWS THE GECKO. It darts up the fender, squeezes into the jamb of the tru and Houdinis into the vehicle with a flick of its tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep powers across the long elevated bridge. The dyin sun tints the clouds and the sky in violent apocalyptic h

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is the part I hate the most. The running. But it's the only thing in my life that's real. The rest is a lie. My name. My birthday. Even Henri. People think he's my father. He's not. His job is to keep me alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri's eyes scan the rear view, on constant vigil. The speedometer never brushes past 60. Daniel has his head against the window, brooding, listening to an iPod.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We are hiding from the Mogadorians. A brutal race that wiped out our entire planet, Lorien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plastic flags whip overhead. Daniel leans against a silve SUV and watches Henri negotiate with the DEALER.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Only nine children escaped the genocide. We were each given a number and sent here to hide. I don't know where the others are. I only know when one of them is murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel sits on the edge of a bathtub. He gently unwraps t bandage that covers his ankle and fearfully inspects the scab that has formed over the wound.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I got the first scar when I was eight. I woke up screaming. We lived in Vermont. The second was on a Tilt-a-Whirl at a fair in Michigan. I was 12. Yesterday was the third. His finger traces the lines of the other two scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lush tropical landscape has browned into flat, dorman farmland. The silver SUV charges through the bleak monoto

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Because of the spell our Elders cast, the Mogs can only kill us in order. That's the reason I've survived this long. But our enemy is relentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is asleep with his earphones on. Henri glances ove his mask of certainty momentarily slips. He looks like a soldier heading into a battle he knows cannot be won.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now their hunt has turned to me. I am number 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired neon sign illuminates the big rigs that RUMBLE pa headed to destinations unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel sullenly stares at a stack of untouched pancakes. Henri slides into the booth, all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florida's clear. I sent a letter to the school and there's nothing in the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even get a chance to say goodbye. Henri keeps going, passes an envelope across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New IDs. Daniel pulls out his birth certificate, reads the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when I think you can't get any less original, you lower the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in originality. I'm interested in untraceable. There are 335,321 John Smiths in the United States. (Note: from this point on, Daniel will be called John.) John looks at him, then abruptly gets up and storms away. Henri drops $20 on the table and calmly heads after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of ancient arcade games blinks. John angrily stabs buttons of a Space Invaders machine as Henri approaches. They are alone. John's eyes never leave the video screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been so long since the last scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got lulled into a false sense of security. That's my fault. John struggles to keep his temper in check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked Florida. I liked having friends. I liked feeling normal. Henri's face softens with paternal compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish that you could have a normal life -- but you can't. Only now does John turn and face him. His eyes blaze with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why fake it? Why not just go hole up in the wilderness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what Number 3 did.
John looks at him, confused. Henri pulls up an article on his iPhone and hands it to John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from an African news site. A man and his son went missing two nights ago. The locals think they were taken by strange beasts. John understands the implication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mogadorians are natural-born hunters. Blending in is our best protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we just keep moving from town to town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I say otherwise -- yes. John waits as a TRUCKER passes through the room. His voic softens but never loses its intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be from someplace, Henri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorien's your home, I don't even remember it. John's tone rubs Henri the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it or not, it's your home too. You have a responsibility to those who died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri and John climb in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a say in where we live. (off Henri's face) You already picked it, didn't you?
Henri REVS the ENGINE to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up, you're going to be living in Paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frigid sheet of RAIN POUNDS the sign that's planted on side of this narrow stretch of rural blacktop: âWELCOME TO PARADISE, OHIO. POP. 5,243â The silver SUV streaks past, its wipers working overtime. kicks up a spray as it speeds down Main Street. The dinky storefronts are garishly decorated for Halloween.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaves are washed in a thousand shades of gold. The S barrels along the drive that twists through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri pulls up in front of a small house. It sits by itse surrounded by trees. Water sluices off the weather-worn garage in the yard behind it. A WOMAN steps out of a mini to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks even perkier than the realtor in Florida. A warm smile graces her round face and she's clutching a fruit basket. For the record, she is called ANNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arizona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you move to Paradise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're an asshole. John waits for a reaction but doesn't get one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because my dad needs peace and quiet to research his book. Henri nods and smiles wryly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a lot easier when you were 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door swings open and Annie proudly escorts Henr and John inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are. Home sweet home. They scan the faded interior. The place is in desperate n of a makeover. A grandfather clock pensively TICKS at the end of the hall. Annie remains relentlessly optimistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First impressions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect. Annie places the fruit basket on the dining table and beg turning on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one word for it. Stewing, John exits into the hall with his duffel bag. An reads the strained dynamic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel your pain. I have a daughter his age. Apparently, I ruin her life on a daily basis. John steps back in, holding a sun-faded poster featuring great Bernie Kosar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy was covering a hole in my wall. Annie's cheeks blush with annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told the handyman to patch that before you arrived. I'm so sorry.
Henri is all charm, gently leads her to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry about it. She nods, grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll knock it off the rent. Keep the poster, Bernie Kosar brings good luck here in the Buckeye State.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped. The wind RUSTLES the trees. John lifts out the last box. As he closes the trunk, he doesn' notice the hitchhiking gecko hotfoot it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri is busy setting up his computer station. John dumps the box on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last of them. I'm hitting the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a new photo first. John crosses and stands against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say Paradise. John gives him a withering look. Henri flashes off a shot The camera is cabled to one of the laptops. TIGHT ON LAPTOP: The image of John pixelates onto a digit grid and a face-recognition program begins to map his fac structure. Henri turns to another laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've imputed the new search words: Daniel Jones. Big Pine Key. Sunset High School. You think of any others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this place sucks.
Henri swivels to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's a story or picture of you on the internet, this program will find it. Our enemy doesn't know who you are -- I want to keep it that way. John nods, knows he's being a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sand Dollar Beach, that's where we were jet skiing. Henri types it in when something SCRATCHES at the door. Their heads instantly turn towards the sound. Tense SILEN SLOW PUSH IN ON THE DOOR as another SCRATCH echoes. Henri is on his feet. He flicks off the lights and silent signals John to retreat down the hall. With the cool air an assassin, Henri unzips a duffel bag and pulls out a sl crystal-handled dagger. As he steps to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... John crouches in the dark, clutching a baseball bat. Suddenly, the light in the bedroom buzzes back on. He hol his breath as the door swings open. He looks up and is relieved to see Henri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found our intruder -- he's a little small for a Mogadorian. At that moment,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slips between Henri's legs. It cocks its head, studies John's face, then pads forward and licks his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog greedily laps a bowl of milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's starving, doesn't have any collar or tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been dumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, another pair of eyes and ears watching the house wouldn't be a bad thing. Henri considers the request, nods. John playfully ruffles the dog's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I need all the luck I can get -- how about Bernie Kosar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters, dressed in black, ready for his first day of school. He dumps his backpack on a chair. Henri places a plate with an omelette and perfectly browned hash browns front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You outdid yourself. What's up? Henri lifts a red backpack into view. John stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already have a backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one has five days of rations, spare clothes, cash and a handheld GPS. Keep it with you at all times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Game's changed. You're in the crosshairs now. You have to be ready to leave at a moment's notice. With or without me. John stares at the backpack, takes in this new reality. H pushes the plate away, snatches the backpack and heads ou the door. Henri stares at the omelette, tastes a pinch of hash browns, then puts the plate on the floor on his way It takes Bernie 2.5 seconds to race over and start to eat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack-o'-lanterns stare out from the âHALLOWEEN BLOCK PA banner strung across the red brick facade. Henri drives away. John slides the red backpack onto his shoulder when hears a FAMILIAR BARK. He turns and is surprised to find BERNIE KOSAR. The little dog is sitting by the flagpole wagging his whi tipped tail. John crosses to him, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie, what the hell... were you hiding in the car? He scoops the dog into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, I was about to take a picture of the little guy. John turns and finds SARAH HARTE. She's his age and is holding an old 35mm Nikon. There is something about her unforced beauty that is instantly enchanting. John shuffles, uncharacteristically nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not supposed to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home. Now. Bernie hops out of his arms and obediently runs towards h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really well-trained. How long have you had him? John turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about your shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No worries. He begins walking towards the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just moved into the house on Old Mill Road. It's John, right?
John swings back, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm not stalking you. My mom said she rented it to a guy with a son my age. Since I know every other face on this quad, that had to be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sarah. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someplace warmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that qualifies as an actual answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to register. She raises her camera to snap a shot of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capturing your first day, even though you're technically six weeks late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't point that at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid the camera's going to steal your soul? She lifts the viewfinder to her eye, adjusts focus. Annoy he covers the lens with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem? I said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only for the yearbook. John regains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not big into having my picture taken. Sorry. As he heads away, Sarah watches, intrigued. CAMERA TRACKS REVEAL MARK JAYNE monitoring the encounter. He's the star quarterback and his chiselled jaw tenses with jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loaded with textbooks, John instinctively bows his head a passes the black eye of a hall security camera and steps locker. He reaches for the combination lock when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: viciously sideswipes him. The textbooks scatter across th checkerboard linoleum. John sees the culprit is Mark Jayn who offers him a taunting grin. John fights his urge to react and watches as Mark struts over to his POSSE OF JOC

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Welcome to Paradise, irony not included. John looks at the teen standing two lockers down. He's go battered skateboard tucked into his backpack and wears an Army surplus jacket. This is SAM GOODE -- genius by birth slacker by choice. He nods after Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Mark Jayne. Quarterback, sheriff's son, he's three years into the best four years of his life. John begins retrieving the fallen books. Sam helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do yourself a favor -- stay off his radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know I was on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were talking to Sarah Harte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was talking to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark and Sarah have been exclusive since Freshmen year.
John looks down the hall and sees Mark wrap his arm aroun Sarah's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's another guy in her airspace, he shoots them down. You got a warning shot. John piles the books into his locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll fire back next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're new, so let me tell you how things work in this misnamed backwater. Football players are gods -- the rest of us are mere mortals. If you want to survive, keep your head down and don't make waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously a wise man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sam by the way. Sam extends his hand. John doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the download. As he SLAMS his locker shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an impressive structure with wraparound bleachers. T Junior gym class jogs around the track. John hangs in the middle of the pack, with his hoodie up, blending in. They pass the GIRLS who are stretching on the pristine fi Sarah's eyes drift towards John. The COACH blows a whistl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, people. Let's hit the gym. The assembled teens GROAN and fan off towards the mouth o tunnel that stares out from the base of the bleachers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John emerges from the tunnel via a door by the stage. Som of his classmates are on the court, passing and dribbling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, half court, three on three. Girls have this basket, boys have that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two simultaneous games are in progress. John sits on the sidelines waiting his turn. He avoids eye contact with Sa who is sitting in the shadow of the basket. However, he d notice Mark Jayne enter and approach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New kid, you're up. Show me what you've got. John steps onto the court and waits for the ball to come way. He steals a glance and sees Sarah and Mark arguing. blur of orange. John swings back and catches the ball. Just as he shoots, he's distracted by Sarah's upset voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goes wild, misses the basket but hits the glass backboard with such force that it SHATTERS. Mark and Sarah are inadvertently forced to separate as sh rain down. All eyes turn to John, who's annoyed at his momentary lapse. TEENS HOOT. The Coach BLOWS his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! Hit the showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeBron, grab a broom. As the gym empties, John looks over and catches Sarah watching him. OFF this silent exchange...

dialogues.speaker: THE INTRICATELY CARVED BOX
dialogues.text: is clutched in Henri's hands. He heads down the hall and stops in front of the grandfather clock. Its tarnished pendulum sways. He unlocks the glass panel and slots the out of sight behind the clock's brass face.
Satisfied with the hiding place, he locks the front and t the key. When he turns back, he finds BERNIE KOSAR. The dog is studying him with his head cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep this our little secret. OFF Bernie's inquisitive eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John joins the line. He sees Sarah sitting by herself, inspecting a photographic contact sheet. His view is bloc by Sam. John rubs his hands which are oddly sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First day here and you're already destroying school property. So much for not making waves. John moves past him and grabs a tray. He's flushed and hi face is now hot and red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the real spectator sport was Mark and Sarah's blowout. John wipes his brow, distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. At that moment, Mark Jayne and his buddy, KEVIN, cut in f of them. Annoyed, John taps Mark on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line starts back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football players get priority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that posted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unwritten rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised your boyfriend didn't tell you. Sam puts his hands up and backs away. Mark smirks at John

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't know your place around here, things can get rough. John holds his ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, I guess I better ask you where I should sit. I was thinking about grabbing that chair next to your girlfriend. In a flash of anger, Mark whips up his tray, hammers it i John's chest, knocking him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk trash? Let's see you back it up. John tries to stand, but is suddenly overcome with a wave pain. He looks down at his hands and is alarmed to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: blooming from his palms! He quickly balls them into fists extinguishing the light from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up! SILENCE has fallen. Still clenching his fists, John rises and stumbles out into the hall. OFF Sarah's concern as sh watches him exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri is on a ladder, adjusting a hidden surveillance cam above the front door, when Bernie starts BARKING. It's an anxious, urgent BARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri steps inside and sees the dog is BARKING at -- THE GRANDFATHER CLOCK. A shaft of white light blooms from within. The shadow of swaying pendulum cuts across Henri's face. As he sprints the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disoriented, John staggers down the hall. Sam catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, hold up! John leans against the wall, keeping his hands out of sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like crap. I'll get the nurse. But as Sam runs off, John heads in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri's SUV roars into view, whipping up a tornado of lea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strips of negatives hang on drying lines. John bursts in SLAMS the door. He slips off his backpack, opens his hand TIGHT ON HIS EYES -- the brilliant light from his palms shrinks his irises to pinpricks. The luminescence is crisp, mercury-glass bright and grows stronger every second. Suddenly, the door opens. John spi in shock. A figure strides through the blinding glare, gently takes his hands and folds them into fists. IT'S HENRI. John looks at him, confusion and fear etched on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri, what's happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. You're going to be okay. John angrily holds up one of his luminescent hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what planet is this okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John steps out of the darkroom wearing Henri's heavy coat His hands are balled and stuffed into the pockets. Henri leads him quickly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John fearfully studies his hands which have returned to normal, then looks over at Henri who seems oddly calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, start talking. What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your first Legacy is starting to manifest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legacy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An extraordinary ability. Yours is called Lumen. They start a lot sooner on Lorien. I was beginning to fear yours would never emerge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew this was going to happen? Why didn't you say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to worry you. You were already under enough pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. John acknowledges the apology, but looks at him, suspicio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else have you been hiding from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains are drawn. Bernie Kosar dozes on the couch while John and Henri sit at the table, staring at the Box

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This couldn't be opened until your first Legacy appeared. Ready? John nods nervously. Henri places the fingertips of his right hand onto five petal-shaped discs inlaid onto the l John cautiously follows suit and places his fingers on th âpetalsâ fanned across the opposite side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: momentarily glow and a SHARP CLICK echoes from within. Jo and Henri pull their hands away and watch as the Box miraculously comes to life. Fissures of light sweep acros the lines of inlaid stone, dividing the lid into sections that begin to twist and reform like high-tech origami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. PUSH IN ON Bernie as he sits up and watches the Box unfol Like an intricate jigsaw, the sections finally regroup, creating a new pattern on the lid. It's a familiar geomet symbol. John touches the crystal pendant that hangs from neck -- the symbols are an exact match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it. John nods, cautiously lifts the lid, revealing a neat assortment of velvet pouches and an array of colored rock They range in size and color but all share a serene beaut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystals from Lorien's core. They'll guide us in your training. John tries to reach for one, but Henri slaps his hand awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Place your hand over them. John follows the instruction and is amazed when a walnut- sized crystal floats up from the Box. It slowly begins to spin and project A SWIRLING HOLOGRAPHIC GALAXY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our solar system. Henri points to a planet. Its oceans are dark with pollut and its sprawling continents are barren and treeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Lorien looked like thousands of years ago. We had all the problems that Earth has today. The planet was dying until our people made a collective decision to change and slowly Lorien began to heal itself -- that's when the Legacies started. John watches as the spinning planet transforms before his eyes. Its oceans turn a vibrant chroma-key blue and the l masses become a lush emerald green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a select few developed these abilities. They became known as the Garde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like your parents and grandparents. John considers this new information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other children in the ship... Henri finishes John's thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're Garde as well. Once you've mastered your Legacies, we'll find them and face the Mogadorians together. John looks at Henri, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Legacy do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any and never will. I'm your Cepan -- a teacher. My job is not just to protect you but to train you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your hand. Henri takes one of John's hands and pulls a cigarette lig from his pocket. John flinches, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. Henri flicks a flame to life and sweeps it under John's outstretched palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel that? Amazingly, the flame harmlessly licks the skin. But when Henri moves the lighter further up John's arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch. John jerks his hand away. Henri kills the flame, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we're done, your entire body will be shielded against fire. John rubs his singed wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get other Legacies too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying would be cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get to pick them off a menu. KNOCK. KNOCK. KNOCK. As John spins to the door, the shimmering galaxy fades and the crystal drops to the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mogs don't knock.
Henri steps to his computer bank and examines a laptop featuring live feeds from a dozen surveillance cameras he installed around the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a girl. John looks over his shoulder and reacts with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens the door and finds Sarah amped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do it? Her accusation startles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eviscerate the entire senior class? She pulls a strip of overexposed 35mm film from her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the darkroom before lunch and they were hanging on the line smiling and looking forward to the future. When I got back, I found 15 rolls of negatives wiped clean. John shrugs innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you weren't in the darkroom today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a tip. If you're going to lie, don't leave a big red backpack at the scene of the crime. She swings his backpack into view. John is mortified. He struggles to find a plausible answer and silently tries t quell the feeling welling in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened. Maybe it's a sign that you should invest in a digital camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Digital sucks. Film tells the truth. Clearly, I'm not going to get that from you. He watches as she angrily heads down the steps and climbs into her car. John glances at his palms and is surprised find they are dimly luminescent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah's car sweeps out of the drive and powers towards to unaware of the truck parked in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is behind the wheel and watches as her headlights fade in the night. OFF his simmering jealousy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie Kosar waits expectantly as Henri pours âDoggie C into a bowl. John steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was returning my backpack. He dumps it by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should stay home from school for a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lies on his bed, staring at his luminescent palms, conflicted by his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight cuts across Bernie Kosar who is SNORING peacefu at the end of the bed. John tosses and turns. He finally sits up, unable to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nursing a mug of black coffee, Henri diligently scans the laptop screens. He's clearly never gone to bed. He looks as John enters wearing track gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going for a run. Bernie trots out and wags his tail pleadingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, buddy, you couldn't keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EPIC AERIAL SHOT LOOKING DOWN AT AN EAGLE as it soars abo the rich kaleidoscope of trees. It almost seems to be following John, who is powering along a narrow track belo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John moves at superhuman speed, leaving a blurring wake o leaves. His foot splits a log as he bounds over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John charges towards a secluded stream. It's 30 feet wide He doesn't slow, leaps off the bank and effortlessly hopscotches from boulder to boulder to the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It offers a high-def view of Paradise. John reaches the t and is exhilarated by the sense of temporary liberation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: alights in a nearby oak tree. John bends to tighten his laces, his eyes fall on the trio of scars branded on his ankle. His happiness dims.
He grits his teeth and takes off for home. As he passes t oak, the CAMERA TRACKS TO REVEAL the gecko scampering dow the gnarled trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is at his locker. He glances over at John's, hoping he'll show. Disappointed, he joins the crisscrossing thro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John âpracticesâ turning his Lumen Legacy âoffâ a Henri watches as John's palms glow. Â  John focuses inten causing them to flare with sudden brilliance. Momentarily blinded, John jerks back and topples off his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits in the stands, doing homework, watching Mark a the football team practice in the cold metallic floodligh ON THE FIELD the ball is hiked to Mark. He looks for an opening and fires a perfect spiral to the RECEIVER in the zone. Mark thumps chests with Kevin and looks up at the stands, only to discover that Sarah is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's playing âsupercatchâ with Bernie. He watches a little guy races back from the woods, clutching a ball. Panting with exertion, the dog lays it at John's feet. Jo smiles, swings back his arm and hauls the ball again. ANGLE ON BALL: It arcs up, sails right over the garage an drops earthwards in the heart of the woods. Unperturbed by the superhuman throw, Bernie hightails aft the ball. Henri steps out and watches, amused, then tosse John a pair of black driving gloves. OFF John's eye roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON ONE OF THE GLOVES. It's now fingerless and on John's hand. He weaves through the preclass crowd and is about to head into the chemistry lab when he sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: disappearing into a room at the end. He's torn, then make decision and does something he shouldn't -- he strides do the hall after her. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is alone, tacking photographs to a large board that lying flat on the carpet. She hears the door CLICK, turns and coolly regards John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you have the wrong room. She rises, walks past him and begins searching the photos scattered on the layout table in the middle of the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the apology come with an explanation? He turns to go, has his hand on the door when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. He looks back. Her face softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we delete Monday and start over? She steps forward and extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John. TIGHT ON THEIR HANDS as they shake. She checks out his fingerless gloves, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice gloves. She crosses to the board, reaches down to lift it when Jo steps behind her.
He effortlessly picks it up and hooks it onto the wall. T stand back. John stares at the collage of high school ima that captures a life he'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know all these people? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curse of a small town. I've been around them my whole life. (pointing to photo) Kim Thomas. She peed in her bed at a sleepover when we were seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil Bailey. President of the Debate Club. Plays five instruments. Doesn't know he's gay yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ross. AP English. She's been here so long, she taught my mom and my four brothers. I'm the baby of the family in case you were wondering. Her curious eyes scour his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Determined to keep the mystery alive, aren't you? His finger arrows in on a photograph of Sarah. It's a can and she's taking a shot with her trademark Nikon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Recovering cheerleader. Wannabe vegetarian but I still love burgers. Dreams of being a photojournalist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never actually admitted that last one to anybody before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your secret's safe with me. She studies him, sensing a kindred spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever feel you don't belong in your own life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every single day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That almost sounded like a straight answer. They look at each other. There's a charged silence. The moment is broken when --

dialogues.speaker: MARK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What's he doing in here? John and Sarah spin to find Mark. Sarah is flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were on two-a-days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach wants me to rest my arm before the scouts come. You didn't answer my question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John was helping me move some boards. John turns to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take off. Mark doesn't take his eyes off John and blocks his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, Sarah, what's up with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you had time to go to his house the other night. Sarah looks at him, stunned by the admission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to figure out what's going on with you. Sarah's shock turns to anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've crossed so many lines I can't even speak to you right now. She hustles out of the room. Mark glares at John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't over. OFF John, unmoved by the threat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is even pinker than the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drawer flies across THE FRAME. The place has been total trashed. Floorboards have been ripped up. Sofas shredded. Nothing has been spared. CAMERA DRIFTS OVER the debris to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mattress has been dissected and its guts lie scattere A TEEN GIRL. kneels in front of John's old desk searching the drawers. She wears a biker jacket, combat boots and has a striking âdon't-fuck-with-meâ face. Frustrated in her search, flings the desk against the wall. It splinters on impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THE STOVE -- a hand twists on the burners. Raw g HISSES. The Teen Girl makes one final scan, then heads fo the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Teen Girl strides down the steps and crosses to a sle Ducatti. She slips on a helmet. PUSH IN on her Arctic-blu eyes as they focus on the house with a strange intensity.

dialogues.speaker: KABBBOOOOOOM
dialogues.text: The house detonates. The concussive force of the blast ri the structure right off its stilts. Tornadoes of flame BL through the windows as the house catapults into the air. Orange reflections flicker on the Girl's visor as she fli it down, REVS the motorcycle and SCREAM-PEELS down the dr backlit by the glittering inferno...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam catches John at the lockers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice freakout the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't feeling well. They twist their combination locks. Sam swings open his door, there's a HISSING POP and A RED INK PACK EXPLODES. It's the kind banks use to foil heists. In a shocking instant, Sam and the contents of his locker are splattere It bears a gruesome resemblance to arterial spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has his door halfway open and ducks back a second before ink pack planted in his locker ERUPTS. The spray misses h face but violently spits across his chest and arms. LAUGH echoes behind them. John spins and finds Mark and his pos TIGHT ON John's hands as he balls them and an angry glow flickers through his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to John, taunting) Told you it wasn't over. Behind them, Sam's laid-back persona cracks. He frantical clears his locker, looking for something. He finally pull out a photo which drips with ink, reels at the jocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assholes. John looks back at Sam. Mark seizes his chance and launch a sucker-punch at John. But John sees it out of the corne of his eye and in a blur of motion whips up his hand and

dialogues.speaker: CATCHES MARK'S FIST.
dialogues.text: John squeezes it vice-tight. Mark grimaces in agony. His buddies back into the CROWD OF TEENS that has gathered. J leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sensation you're feeling -- remember it. With a quick push, John shoves Mark back against the lock Mark DENTS a door and slides to the floor, his eyes flari with lacerated pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show's over. The crowd disperses. Mark gets to his feet and exits with his friends, but shoots John one final wounded glare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, ink-stained water Hitchcocks down the drain. John wrings out his black T-shirt. He sees Sam's reflection in the mirror. Sam puts some clothes on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I raided lost and found. He holds up a puke-green sweater decorated with red snowm John turns back to the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Nobody loses anything cool. He sits and begins to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, the way you thrashed Mark back there. Awesome move. John acknowledges that with a nod. Whip-dries his shirt. Sam plucks up the photo. The ink is now dried and cracked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in the picture? Sam stares at it, nostalgic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad. My real dad. I took it the summer before he split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dragged me and my mom all over the Yucatan. He was looking for evidence of ancient astronauts. All I got was Montezuma's Revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a fun vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Insane. He called himself an anthropologist even though he only made it through one semester of college. He rises and tosses the ruined picture into the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always thought he'd come back one day -- who was I kidding. The guy's a joke. As the BELL RINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The football stadium rises like a monolith in the backgro John strides towards the tree line, headed home.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: John. He turns in surprise as Sarah approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about the lockers. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll live. He starts off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke up with Mark. He stops, slowly turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about doing it for a while... today just finally pushed me over the edge.
He studies her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me? She bows her head, suddenly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made the right call. The certainty of his voice soothes her. She looks up and holds his gaze. Their attraction is undeniable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halloween Block Party's tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the banners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be on Main Street hiding behind my camera if you want to swing by. He says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't expecting an actual response. I could text you later. Do they have cell phones on Planet John? She holds out her phone. John looks at it tentatively, th takes it. As he inputs his number, he hears the BLARE of car horn, looks up and sees Henri waiting in his SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't that your friend from the other night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal called. Said there was an incident.
John stares out the window, guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy was messing with me. I took care of it. Problem solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stronger and faster because of Earth's gravity -- you shouldn't use that advantage to settle petty scores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was no big deal. Don't blow it out of proportion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't risk everything over wounded pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't looking for a fight. It just happened. Get off my back. Henri pulls a printout from his coat. John unfolds it. ANGLE ON PRINTOUT: It's from the Florida Keynoter website and features a photo of the charred stilt house. John's gut churns as he stares at the image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Article says it was arson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were clean. There's no way the Mogs can track us here. Henri shakes his head, shifts into gear and starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can track us anywhere. I think it's time you saw what you're really up against.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight razors across workbenches cluttered with rusty tools. Henri and John stand in the middle of the space.

is open on the floor between them. John lifts his hand an holds it over the crystals. ONE RISES. It's white and as thick as two fingers. It floats in fron of John's face. He tentatively reaches out. When he grips it, a shock wave of light blasts out, totally WIPING OUT FRAME and transporting him into A VISCERAL MEMORY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXPLOSIONS rock and the SCREAMS of the dying echo. AN OLD MAN hustles A TERRIFIED BOY through the murderous bombardment. The air is choked with ash and smoke. The boy is 7-year-old John. The man is his grandfather. Young John glances up and sees

dialogues.speaker: AN ARMADA OF BATTLESHIPS
dialogues.text: eclipsing Lorien's two moons. The angular hulls of the cr are scarred from galactic battles new and ancient and unl an endless crisscrossing FRENZY OF MISSILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Loric with subtitles) Keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't look out of place in ancient Rome. Young John and his grandfather race up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A statue of Lorien's most famous warrior, Pittacus Lore, towers in the middle of the chamber. His noble face is illuminated in a shaft of flame-tainted moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTSTEPS ECHO
dialogues.text: Young John and his grandfather scramble across the space straight into the path of TWO MOGADORIAN SOLDIERS. The Soldiers' pallid faces flash with smiles. Swords draw they move in for the kill when one is skewered in the thr by a crystal-handled dagger.

spurts from the wound. The Soldier's body fractures like glass and DISINTEGRATES in a shower of embers as he drops the floor. The other Mogadorian spins and trades SPARKING sword strokes with A CLOAKED FIGURE. It's a violent battle of wills which ends when the Cloake Figure kicks up the dead Soldier's sword and impales it i the Mogadorian's chest. The Soldier EVISCERATES in a clou of HISSING cinders. Young John watches in awed terror as the Cloaked Figure s towards him and pulls back his hood. IT'S HENRI. He looks younger, the years of hiding have aged him. John grandfather lifts a familiar crystal pendant from his nec and places it over Young John's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your Cepan. Go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life is my life now. I will always protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must survive. A BLAST scorches across the space. Henri spots

dialogues.speaker: A MOGADORIAN COMMANDER
dialogues.text: hunkered behind a column, his red coat billows behind him like a curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are already hunting you! Go! Henri plucks a crystal ankle-dagger from his boot, grabs young John and charges up. As the Commander breaks cover, Henri hurls the dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dives out of its path but ROARS as the blade SPARK-RIPS across his right cheek like a hot poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri yanks Young John by the hand. They take off in one direction while John's grandfather heads off in the other

dialogues.speaker: A MOGADORIAN TRANSPORT CRAFT
dialogues.text: suddenly swoops between them. The HOWLS of its occupants ricochet through the night. The heat from its engines was the ground, warping the destruction like a ghastly mirage two bay doors open. Young John looks back through the hea haze and catches a impressionistic view as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leap out. Their reptilian bodies ripple with muscle and their oversize heads glint with raptor-like jaws. The Pik mercilessly rip into John's grandfather. Young John races help, but Henri wrenches him back. CAMERA PUSHES IN TIGHT YOUNG JOHN'S FACE as he screams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooooooo! THE MEMORY ENDS and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON JOHN screaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooooooo! He drops the crystal and stumbles back. The experience ha left him traumatized. Henri steps towards him, but John i too overwhelmed and runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stone angrily SKIPS across the water. John is about to toss another when Bernie Kosar trots into view. He ruffle the dog's fur but doesn't turn when Henri steps out of th woods and crosses to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw my grandfather. I saw what you did to the Mogadorians -- you saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of Lorics sacrificed their lives so that you could live.
John is still trying to process the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said I must survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elders had a plan. You weren't on that ship by chance. The nine of you were chosen for a reason. Even if only two of you live, together you'll pose a grave threat to our enemy. Consumed by bitterness, John hurls another stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw what they did to Lorien. How can nine or six or two of us take on that army? It's hopeless. Henri knows he has to pull him out of this mournful funk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought we'd get off Lorien alive -- but we did. I didn't know how we could survive on a strange planet -- but we have. I gave us six months before the Mogs found us -- it's been 10 years. Don't give up now. Henri grips John's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the potential to do great things. Even if you don't see it -- I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you put so much faith in me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because your life is my life. If you quit, then everything I've worked for and sacrificed is meaningless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember -- nothing is inevitable. The fragile SILENCE is broken when John's cell phone BLEA He scans a text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sarah. The Block Party's tonight. I'll say I can't make it. Henri sees John is wracked with doubt and confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... go. John looks at him, surprised by this paternal gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had enough for one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Halloween parade drifts past the CROWDS packing the sidewalks. Icicle lights twinkle in the trees. EXCITED KI in costume zigzag past John. It's small-town Americana at its best. ET waddles by holding a JEDI's hand. A SLAP ON GLASS. John turns and is amused to find Sam standing among the mannequins in the display window of a sporting goods stor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An annoying CHIME plays as the door opens and John enters The store is deserted. The stock needs to be updated and shelves could use a dust. Sam approaches wearing an apron

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not by choice. (pointing to sign) Ed's my stepdad. He's under the delusion that if people eat enough candy apples and kettle corn, they'll suddenly have the urge to buy sporting goods. John plucks a hockey mask from the basket on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put those on special tonight for any wannabe Jason Voorhees. Sam pulls off his apron, revealing a T-shirt emblazoned w the words âFuture Supervillainâ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw this. Let me lock up. I'll hang with you. He steps to the door and twists the closed sign into view

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your stepdad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit the tavern at 6:00. He's already hammered by now. I'll probably find him passed out on the doorstep. Every night is trick âr treat at my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Sam wander past the parade floats lined up along road bordering the woods. Stalls sell hot dogs and cotton candy. John subtly scans the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's over there. John follows Sam's gaze and finds Sarah taking shots of s KIDS dunking for apples. She pulls the camera from her ey sees John and smiles as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it. (re: Sam's shirt) Like the T-shirt, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guidance Counsellor said I need to set goals for myself. Figured I'd aim high. She looks back at John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of Halloween in Paradise? John regards a particularly over-the-top float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should pull out all the stops next year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you haven't had the full experience until you've been on the Haunted Hayride.
She motions to the picnic area where TEENS are lining up get on tractor-pulled hay wagons. The wagons lurch throug the mouth of a giant cutout devil and into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a sec. She steps to the face-painting booth. It's sponsored by t local realtor who is Sarah's mom, Annie. Sarah hands Anni her camera. Sam whispers to John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed. Before John can respond, Sarah steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three on a wagon might get a little crowded. I'll meet you two on the other side. He gives John a not-so-subtle wink of encouragement. John and Sarah join the end of the line and watch Sam head awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely unique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't really talked to him since 8th grade. Mark had a tight circle. If you weren't a jock or cheerleader, you didn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you broke free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. OFF their growing connection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The path is lined with human heads piked to wooden stakes SCREAMS, WAILS and GHOULISH HOWLS boom from hidden speake
OMINOUS POV: WATCHES from the trees as a wagon with John Sarah RATTLES into view. It's driven by the GRIM REAPER.

dialogues.speaker: FIVE GIANT RUBBER SPIDERS
dialogues.text: drop from the trees. Sarah freaks as the arachnids dangle over their heads on wires. She rubs her hair, flustered, looks over at John, who is coolly amused by the cheap sca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even a flinch. None of this scares you, does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trembling on the inside. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can smile. I was starting to have my doubts. She takes his hand. They CLATTER past a series of grisly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEEN jerks and SCREAMS in mock agony as he is fried in antiquated electric chair. A BLOOD-SPLATTERED DOCTOR CACKLES as he hacksaws the legs a CHEERLEADER chained to a gurney. A squad of blood-hungry VAMPIRIC FOOTBALL PLAYERS attacks rival team of WEREWOLVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghosts float in the branches as the wagon LURCHES to a st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell's Gate, everybody off. The duo reluctantly clambers off the back and watches as hay wagon circles back the way it came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we make it through, we're home free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pendulums in front of them. Sarah SCREAMS and clenches John's hand harder. A pathway of lights floods on, illuminating a skull-capped gate. The words âYOUR NUMBER'S UP!â
are scrawled across it in fake blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Sarah step through the gate and enter a natural tunnel of dense, overhanging branches. A fog machine gent COUGHS, and spiderwebs stretch across the sides. They are about 20 feet into the tunnel when the lights go out. Somewhere a CHAINSAW sputters to life. White strobe lights suddenly flare on and

dialogues.speaker: TWO CHAINSAW-WIELDING ZOMBIES
dialogues.text: burst through the gates behind them. The teens take off. It's like a flickering scene from a demented silent movie The Zombies have almost caught up when the strobe abruptl ends. The SOUND of the chainsaws FADES and John and Sarah stop, panting and LAUGHING with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was insane. IT'S PITCH BLACK. A werewolf HOWLS somewhere in the darkness. Something brushes past John's leg. He spins, suddenly unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just part of the ride. He turns, sees a flash of purple light and hears the rust of HEAVY FOOTSTEPS on all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? As he steps forward,

dialogues.speaker: A THICK BRANCH
dialogues.text: cuts through the dark and viciously SMACKS John on the ba He drops to the ground like a sack. Figures emerge from t shadows and he hears a DESPERATE STRUGGLE behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! Stop it! John tries to stand, but a boot CRACKS him in the ribs. Another strikes the side of his face. He is surrounded. H attackers are brutal and unrelenting. Over the LOOPING SOUNDTRACK OF B-MOVIE NOISES, Sarah's muffled SCREAMS DIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah! Sa- His voice is cut off as a fist SMASHES into his jaw and t steel cap of a combat boot SLAMS his groin. John staggers but is viciously kicked back to the ground. PUSH IN ON JOHN'S FACE as it hardens with blind rage. In blur of motion he reaches up, grabs two of his attackers their coats and hammers their skulls together. As they dr John spins to meet his other two foes with BLINDING PALMS OF LIGHT. The assailants are illuminated in the phosphorescent glar They're not Mogadorians but rather FOOTBALL JOCKS. One is Mark Jayne's buddy Kevin. They're wearing zombie makeup and military fatigues and have night-vision goggle strapped to their faces. John angrily strides forward, palm outstretched. NIGHT-VISION POV: Everything is an overexposed blur until

dialogues.speaker: WHAAAAM
dialogues.text: John brutally clotheslines one, then pummel-rams Kevin in chest, sending him flying back 10 feet into a tree. Kevin slumps, out for the count. John arcs a glowing hand throu the darkness. SARAH IS GONE. He plucks up the Jocks' fallen goggles and heads off with Terminator-like determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is carried through the woods by TWO ZOMBIE JOCKS in camouflage fatigues and night-vision goggles. She SCREAMS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me! She futilely tries to wrestle free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is waiting by the exit to the hayride when he hears -

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (in the woods) Help! Somebody! Something about her terrified tone alerts Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah? She doesn't answer. He hesitates a moment, then charges i the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freaky shadows crisscross as John uses his luminescent pa to navigate his way through the labyrinth of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam scrambles blindly through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Sam turns in the direction of JOHN'S VOICE. He's about to head towards it when

dialogues.speaker: TWO ZOMBIE JOCKS
dialogues.text: trudge into view. Sam darts behind a tree. Suddenly, the area is flooded with preternatural white light. He can he the sounds of a SCUFFLE and one of the Jocks flies past a CRASHES in a heap while the other SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You're blinding me! Stop! Sam cautiously sneaks a peek, shields his eyes with a han WHAT HE SEES: John pins the Jock to a tree and holds a luminous palm up to the lenses of the teen's goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Sarah? Tell me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd Falls. Now turn off that damn flashlight! John rips off the Jock's goggles, then pile-slides him 15 feet into a rotten stump and takes off in a blur of speed CAMERA STAYS ON SAM. OFF his stunned reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rocky promontory overlooks a crescent-shaped waterfall which drops into a swimming hole below. The Zombie Jocks carry Sarah into view and dump her in front of Mark. She' wild-cat angry when she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy! Where's John? Mark nods the Zombie Jocks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. It's a practical joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear if you hurt him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you give a shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my face, Mark, you're pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the best thing that ever happened to you and I'm giving you one more chance. Appalled by his hubris, Sarah turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't walk away from me! Mark grabs her. Sarah wrenches free, but loses her balanc and falls back on the ground. Mark's rage is transplanted concern. He steps towards her to help when --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Back off! Mark watches John step out. Blood trickles from a cut abo John's right eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! Are you okay? He nods. Mark looks past him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are Kevin and Joe? John holds up a clutch of night-vision goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, those are police property! John flings them over Mark's head into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill you! With lightning speed, John grabs Mark's arm, spins him, pinning him to a tree. Blinded by rage, John jerks Mark's arm up behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! Stop! Mark is in real pain. Transfixed with anger, John keeps twisting. Sarah looks at him, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his throwing arm! But he doesn't stop until she finally steps forward and s him across the face. Startled, John lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football's all he's got. John stumbles back, ashamed, and heads into the woods. Sa offers Mark a look of disgust and follows after John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John charges into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! Wait. Sarah catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I didn't want you to break his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not mad at you. I'm mad at myself. She stops, faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea Mark would pull something like that. He has seriously gone off the deep end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's in love with you. Wants you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not love. Their eyes meet in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk me home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a picture-book perfect neighborhood. Most of the hou are festively decorated with front-yard graveyards and co festooned trees. John walks with Sarah. They come to the prettiest house on the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me. John stares at the dozen jack-o'-lanterns arranged on the porch. They glare back with flickering bucktooth grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Wait until the Christmas decorations go up. My mom decks the halls with so many lights, you can see our house from space. Stray TRICK-OR-TREATERS race past. She motions to the cut above his eye, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this? Wouldn't waste their time. She looks at him, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to tell me how you took out those football players, are you?
He says nothing. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't get you. She steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I feel like I can trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can. The air is charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. Sarah swings open the white picket gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. As she turns back, John steps forward and kisses her. Although taken by surprise, Sarah quickly succumbs to his passion. However, as their kiss intensifies,

dialogues.speaker: THE JACK-O'-LANTERNS
dialogues.text: rise and hover in midair. Sarah has her back to them, but when John's eyes momentarily flicker open, he sees the or grinning back. Startled, he pulls away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: instantly drop and SMASH onto the porch, their candles blowing out on impact. Sarah spins and stares at the jack lanterns, pulp oozes through their cracked shells. Suspicious, she slowly turns, looks at John for an explanation. He does his best to cover his stunned reacti Fat drops of RAIN begin to fall. John puts up his hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go. OFF Sarah, watching him melt into the downpour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain HAMMERS. Bernie is asleep on a blanket. John creeps into the darkness, soaked to the bone, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard on the police scanner that eight boys were beaten up in the woods tonight. Henri turns on a light, nursing a mug of coffee. Bernie wakes. John pulls off his hood. Henri looks at the cuts a bruises on John's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a stupid thing to do. What were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They attacked me. If I hadn't defended myself, I'd be in the ER right now. Would that have been the better choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to start trusting me! Emotionally charged, John points his finger at Henri, accidentally causing the mug to telekinetically EXPLODE. Coffee and shards splatter across the floor. Henri looks John, stunned. John shrugs sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was getting to that. I got a new Legacy. Henri absorbs that revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telekinesis. That's a big step. Must have been triggered by the fight. John doesn't correct him, averts his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to teach you how to control these abilities. We'll start working on that tomorrow. The conversation is suddenly interrupted by the repetitiv WHINE OF AN ALARM. They cross to the bank of computers. Henri urgently stabs commands into a keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Henri pulls up a website.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a hit on one of the search words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a paranormal blog. âThey Walk Among Us!â ANGLE ON COMPUTER: A video buffers into motion. It's handheld and jerky.
