It WHIP-PANS over some sand and joins group of Teens huddled over a figure lying in the surf. H holding his ankle and light seeps between his fingers. John's chest pounds with fear as he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Sand Dollar Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a cell phone camera. There's enough for the Mogs to ID your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take it down? Henri remains ice calm and starts typing commands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Henri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your fault. There's still nothing to trace us here. Henri glances up from his screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could take all night. Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John dumps his hoodie on the floor and slumps on his bed. pulls his phone out of his jeans and sees a new text mess from Sam. He CLICKS it open.

PUSH IN ON JOHN'S FACE as he scans the message with alarm He sits bolt-upright, gripped with dread. He checks the message again. TIGHT ON PHONE: âI SAW WHAT U DID IN THE WOODS. NEED 2 2NITE. MY GARAGE.â JOHN hits delete and clenches the phone in his palm. A ba night just got worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri is illuminated by the dirty glow on the computers. His fingers work the keys with expert precision. He's so focused on the task that he doesn't notice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: blur ACROSS THE FRAME of one of the surveillance camera screens and disappear into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John cautiously approaches. It's a â50s ranch style. Th garage adjoins the house. The lights are out. RAIN bullet off the garage door which is partially concertinaed open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slides into view. It takes a second for his eyes to adjust. A pickup sits under a white tarp. There's no sign of Sam until he Boo Radley's out of the shadows behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've narrowed it down to three possibilities: you're a genetic experiment, you're a freak of nature, or you're an extraterrestrial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you think happened tonight... Sam steps closer, watery reflections ripple down his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands lit up like a firefly on crack, you tossed those football players around like crash test dummies, and you took off faster than an Olympic runner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I leave anything out? John silently reels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to know who you are. John looks at Sam, realizes he's not going to give up. He hesitates, then finally surrenders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a survivor from a planet called Lorien. Sam absorbs this confession with awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad... he's from there too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri's not my dad. He's my Guardian. If he found out you knew about us, we'd be gone by morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to leave Paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't tell anyone. John nods, grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I want to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tarp is whipped off the pickup truck. It's an old For Sam and John stand before it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops found it abandoned in the middle of Route 20, just south of White Sands, New Mexico. It was my dad's. He went missing six years ago. He was on one of his crazy fact-finding trips. He believed we weren't alone in the universe. Sam rubs his hand across the hood, wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom figured he was having an affair and took off. All these years I thought she was right. Now you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't prove anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It proves he wasn't crazy. I'm starting to think that he didn't bail on us... that maybe something else happened out there -- that he was taken. The moment is broken by the SLAM of the front door and th sound of ANGRY FOOTSTEPS. Sam instantly tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess the bar closed.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sam! Where are you? His speech is slurred and aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: ED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You think I wouldn't hear you locked up early! John looks at Sam, shocked and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he finds you here, it'll be worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. Sam crosses to the door leading into the main house and h inside. SHOUTS erupt almost immediately. John flinches, wanting to intervene, but finally turns, hustles under th garage door and slips into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri is hammering at the keyboard of one of his computer John enters with two mugs of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look wiped. Henri turns and smiles playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't the only who was up last night. John nervously hands Henri one of the cups and lies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah texted me. I went over to her house. Henri buys the explanation and swings back to his compute

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried every trick I know, but I can't crack that blog's firewall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find where the site's located and take it offline manually. The URL source has been run through a labyrinth of servers, it could take weeks to track down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help. Henri takes a gulp of coffee and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can. Get changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A WELDING TORCH as it's sparked to life. Its flame HISSES as Henri sweeps it towards John, who is standing shirtless. Bernie watches, curious, as Henri was the flame harmlessly up John's naked arm and torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are now adorned with Thanksgiving banners. John and Sam head past the lockers. Mark and the Jocks move ou of their way, acknowledging the new high school dynamic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using his telekinesis, John strains to lift a tennis ball It momentarily RATTLES, then stops. Henri is not impresse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie darts ahead as John and Sarah walk through a crims cascade of falling leaves. As they kiss, the leaves aroun them freeze midair and slowly begin to drift upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John helps Sam with a dusty box. It's stuffed with Sam's dad's old papers and books. We CATCH tantalizing glimpses images: Stonehenge, Machu Picchu, the Rings of Saturn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Vandy student hangout. CAMERA DRIFTS over a row of computer terminals and FINDS the Teen Girl who torched th stilt house. She's studying her computer screen intently. REVERSE TO REVEAL: She is watching the cell phone footage John on the âThey Walk Among Usâ blog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under Henri's watchful gaze, John focuses on a tennis bal It RISES. John grins in triumph, causing the ball to drop and bounce on the floor. Strike two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark silently stews when he sees Sarah and John sitting together at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie pogos on his back legs, trying to bite the tennis that John telekinetically hovers just out of the dog's re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A LAPTOP scrolling with endless lines of URL addresses. REVERSE TO REVEAL Henri studying the screen. Waiting. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is fully submerged in an old claw-foot tub. GO TO JOHN'S DISTORTED VIEW LOOKING UP at Henri as he dro match into the tub. The liquid instantly IGNITES and we realize John's lying in gasoline. He sits up, rests his hands behind his head as the FLAMES harmlessly lick his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees are now bare. John stands 20 feet from Henri an nods. Henri flicks the switch of an automated tennis ball server. John's face is a mask of concentration as the yel balls fly towards him. He holds up his hand and the balls STOP IN MIDAIR. It's like they've hit an invisible wall two feet from his hand. They hang there. John sees a smile sneak onto Henri face and momentarily loses focus, causing the wall to collapse and the balls to drop into the mud. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie looks like a drowned rat. He's sitting in the tub being scrubbed by John and Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see any family pictures around. I guess the photo aversion is hereditary. He greets the observation with a shrug. She carries on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom... grandparents. Is there anyone else in your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago. It's just me and my dad now. John uses a nail brush to clean the beagle's ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the feeling he doesn't like me very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes him a while to warm up to people. Sarah considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanksgiving's tomorrow. Why don't you bring your dad and celebrate with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Are there going to be a lot of people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tsunami of relatives. But don't worry, I'll shield you from the wave. Besides, I want everyone to meet you. She playfully splashes him. Their faces inch closer. They begin making out hot and heavy until Henri suddenly walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found the -- Caught in the act, the teens lurch away from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just giving Bernie a quick bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're clearly putting a lot of effort into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better hit the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow. Twoish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Mr. Smith. OFF John as she hustles out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri sits in front of his computers. John enters with Bernie, who is wrapped in a beach towel. He begins drying the dog in front of the fire. Henri breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally tracked the location of that blog. It's a house in Warsaw, Indiana. About four hours from here. I'm heading up there tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah invited us to Thanksgiving. I told her we'd be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send my regrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't go alone. It could be dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't risk taking you. I'll leave early and be back by five. John looks up and sees Henri sitting in solitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever get lonely? Surprised by the question, Henri swivels to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I? I have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. All these years, there's never been anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We aren't like humans. Once we fall in love, it's for life. The pain of separation is unbearable. Henri's face clouds with melancholy and he abruptly gets As he heads into the kitchen John studies him with new ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam billows as Henri washes up. He keeps his back to Jo when he enters. John waits then softly asks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her name? Henri slots a plate onto the draining board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anastasia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left her to save me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not responsible for what happened to her -- they are. He slowly turns and regards John with deep paternal conce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked at her the way you look at Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't come with us when we leave -- and we always have to leave, you know that. John nods, not wanting to deal with that reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hoping to protect you from that pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't protect me from everything. OFF Henri's sad smile of acknowledgement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Halloween decorations have been replaced by a Thanksgiving display. Wearing khakis and a pale blue Oxford, John tentatively w up the front path. The warm sound of LAUGHTER drifts from inside. He takes a breath and rings the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a Norman Rockwell cover come to life. Every inc of counter space is filled with platters of food. John watches Sarah, Annie, and a boisterous ASSORTMENT OF RELATIVES put the finishing touches to the Thanksgiving feast. KIDS rush in and out in a manic game of tag. John is captivated by the sense of family and celebration things he's never known in his own life. Sarah steps over She's wearing a funky-cool vintage dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we're on gravy-boat duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table is decorated with garlands of autumn leaves and elaborate pine cone centerpiece. Sarah places the last turkey-shaped gravy boat onto the table. She smiles at Jo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just taking it all in. She crosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you came. They tenderly kiss until Annie bustles in carrying a stea bowl of mashed potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind me. She puts the bowl on the table and grabs Sarah's camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a picture of you two lovebirds. Sarah cringes as Annie lifts the camera to her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. No. John really doesn't like having his --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Let her take it. The gesture means the world to Sarah. He puts his arm aro her. Sarah nestles her face against his. As the flash WIP OUT THE FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red candles flicker. Sarah's DAD is expertly carving the turkey. Everybody is at the table. John sits next to Sara She holds his hand under the table. It's Hallmark worthy until the carriage clock on the mantel CHIMES. IT'S SIX O'CLOCK.
John looks at his phone. No messages. His brow creases wi concern. He turns to Sarah, whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to check in with Henri. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John speed dials as he steps out into the cold. He holds phone to his ear. It rings three times and then is answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri? CLICK. The call is hung up. Suddenly on edge, John redial This time it's picked up immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you one of them too? John reacts to the chilling menace of the Man's tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? Where's Henri? CLICK. John jerks the phone from his ear and stares at it panicked. He paces, desperate and unsure, then gets an id and punches another number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food is getting cold. Everybody is waiting for John. Sarah catches her mother's disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what's taking him so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah steps out just in time to see John climb into a pic truck. It's the one from Sam's garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! He looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Henri. I have to go. Sorry. OFF her confused disappointment as the truck SQUEALS away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I owe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything to get out of Thanksgiving at my house. He offers John a weary smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked out that blog on the way over. Saw the video. What was the deal with your ankle? John pulls up his khakis, shows Sam the trio of scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kind of look like the symbols in my dad's research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abduct people? No. Irritated, he covers them back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the ones you said were hunting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're capable of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get to Warsaw -- now.
Suddenly, John's cell phone RINGS. He snatches it up, but disappointed to see the name âSARAHâ flashing on the hits ignore and the truck hurtles into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dilapidated Victorian. Mist shrouds the yard which littered with junked cars and trash. The pickup crawls to stop in the shadows across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teens sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number 417. Henri tracked the URL to that house. Sam scans the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see his SUV anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would have parked it across town. Sam opens the glove compartment and pulls out a revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stole it from Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move. John yanks Sam's arm away from the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called you because I needed a ride, not a sidekick. If I could have run here, I would have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home. I'll call you when I get back. OFF Sam as John climbs out alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's graveyard quiet. John nervously sneaks down the side the house. His breath fogs as he inch-CREAKS up the woode

He squats in front of the door. He holds up a luminescent palm and uses it like a flashlight to sweep the interior. WHAT HE SEES: Take-out boxes litter the filthy counter. T sink is swamped with dirty dishes. The light washes acros semiautomatic sitting by a packet of Lucky Strikes.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: See anything? Annoyed, John spins and finds Sam creeping towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They might know where my dad is! John realizes Sam is determined. He sweeps his hand back over the kitchen door. His palm illuminates a familiar CRYSTAL-HANDLED DAGGER. It's lying on the counter by the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri's here. John âturns offâ his palm and reaches for the door ha Sam anxiously swats his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Other than strength, speed and night-light, what powers have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telekinesis -- but that's a work in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No invisibility, X-ray vision, flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, we drove here. Sam takes a deep breath, psyching himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm ready. Let's do it. But as John reaches for the door handle, the kitchen ligh suddenly turns on and a MAN enters. He's built like a wrestler and goes by the name of FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a Lucky Strike clenched between his lips, Frank pick the packet on the table and is pissed to discover it's em He crushes it in his fist and crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Sam are gone. Frank steps out and locks the door He flicks away his cigarette as he heads down the stairs. CAMERA FOLLOWS the butt as it cartwheels into SAM'S LAP. He's crouched next to John at the side of the porch. He frantically begins trying to extinguish the stub. John clamps his hand over Sam's mouth and snuffs the cigarette between his fingers. Once Frank's safely around the corne John releases his hand. The duo silently climbs onto the porch. John squats in fr of the door. His hand shakes as he holds it out towards t lock and concentrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up. Hurry up. Hurry up. There's a LOUD CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just dead bolted it! Way to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New plan -- follow Lucky Strike. Text me if he comes back. Sam sneaks off after Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON LOCK as the dead bolt turns by itself and the do swings open. John cautiously crosses the threshold. He holds up his right hand, dims his palm to a dull-blue glo He retrieves Henri's dagger and tentatively heads into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is filmed with dust. It's freezing and John's BREATH FOGS in the hazy aura his palm casts. The naked floorboards CREAK. Fear bites as John scans the lifeless gloom, not sure where to start. TIGHT ON HIS SHOE as it brushes a mousetrap. SNAP!

His breath catches in his throat. He âturns offâ his His heart thumps as he waits for something to react to th noise. But nothing does. As his eyes adjust to the dark, notices a rectangle of light faintly leaking from the doo that leads down into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ancient stairs sag as John slowly descends. The space illuminated by a single naked bulb. The sound of DRIPPING WATER hammers the silence. John scans the rabbit warren o rooms and sees a figure chained to a chair in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri! He races over. But as he reaches for Henri's gag, a YOUNG MAN steps out of the shadows holding a baseball bat. John turns too late and the bat strikes his left side. He drop the dagger as he falls to the floor, his ribs searing. Th man, BRET, raises the bat again. John focuses his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whips out of Bret's grip and torpedoes towards John -- wh ducks out of the way as the bat flies past. Confused, Bre lurches forward. John scrambles for the bat, clenches it his hand, and swings it into the young man's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: knocks the light as he topples into a column and CRASHES the cement, out cold. It's over in a violent blur. John sits stunned for a moment. The swinging bulb casts surrea shadows as he spins back to Henri, telekinetically âunl the padlock securing the chains, and rips off the gag. Henri is groggy and his face is swollen from brutal beati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life is my life, remember? Henri tries to shake his drug-induced haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked my way in. Thought the big guy was buying it. He rubs a wound on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was asking him about the video when the other one shot me from behind... some sort of animal tranq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting rusty. Suddenly, John's phone VIBRATES. It's a message from Sam âGET OUT NOW!â

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to leave! John helps Henri up, they race for the stairs when Bret's hand grabs John's ankle, tripping him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri! Henri smashes his boot into Bret's face, knocking him out good. John staggers up, they spin for the stairs just as

dialogues.speaker: SAM AND FRANK
dialogues.text: head down them into view. Frank holds the revolver agains Sam's neck. Their shadows crisscross under the swaying bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay planted or I'll blow your friend's head off. Henri looks at John in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to help. John and Henri put up their hands. John focuses on the gu but as the light bulb sweeps past, he causes it to EXPLOD THE ROOM PLUNGES INTO DARKNESS. Henri body-slams Frank, sending the revolver skittering. as he wrenches Sam to safety,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to the pickup fly out of Sam's pocket and slide under the stairs. John flashes on his palm, casting everything in eerie blue light. On all fours, Frank scrambles for the fallen weapon. It's almost within reach when he is lifted right off the groun an invisible force.
Sam looks over at John, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one from the video! You're the one they're after. With tremendous telekinetic effort, John slams Frank agai the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you know! Franks says nothing. John trains his palm light on the bi man's face. It's like a blinding interrogation lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start talking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what they're called. The one in the red coat said he'd kill me if I didn't do what he wanted. This revelation stuns Henri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mogadorians... they've been here? Frank nods in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me to call if anyone came asking about the video. Sweat beads John's face from the mental exertion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wanted me to hold your friend until they got here. Henri urgently retrieves Sam's gun and his dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to go! Now! John âreleasesâ Frank, who drops onto the floor like and is knocked out. At that moment, a razor-thin line of dust drops from the floorboards above.

dialogues.speaker: SOMEONE IS UPSTAIRS.
dialogues.text: John immediately extinguishes his palm. The trio stands frozen, necks craned up, ears pricked as the floorboards CREAK above them. They are definitely not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR MOGADORIAN SOLDIERS stalk through the house. Their l black coats SILENTLY sweep. One sniffs the air like a bloodhound and motions towards the basement door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAAAAM! -- the door is shredded off its hinges and flies down the stairs. The Mogadorian patrol storms through the cloud of splinters. Frank and Bret lie where they fell, b there's no sign of John, Henri or Sam. Pissed, one of the Mogadorians strides towards a small blacked-out window. He punches out the glass with his fis and catches sight of Sam clambering over the back fence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Henri and Sam pile in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, get us out of here! Sam reaches into his jeans, then frantically checks his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have dropped the keys! Henri keeps his cool, looks at John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Henri's calm eyes never leave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can. John nods, puts his hand on the dash and closes his eyes. The engine TURNS OVER but doesn't start. Sam looks up the street, panicked, as
climbs out of a black SUV and storms towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up! John's brow is furrowed with concentration. The Mog unsheathes his sword as he runs. With a superhuman leap, lands on the hood -- TWAAAAACK! John and Henri spin out o the way as the sword SHATTERS the windshield and impales the back of the seat, missing them by a mouse hair. As the Mogadorian withdraws the sword to strike again, He sweeps up his dagger and stakes it into the Mog's neck.

dialogues.speaker: VRRRROOMMM
dialogues.text: The engine ROARS to life. The Mogadorian tumbles off the hood, magenta light spurting from his wound. John turns t Sam, who is petrified, and SCREAMS...

dialogues.speaker: DRIVE
dialogues.text: Sam wrenches the shaft into gear and floors the gas. The Mogadorian EVISCERATES in a frenzy of embers. The truck bursts through the blizzard of sparks and STREAK-PEELS aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS the swish of a familiar red coat as its own slowly descends the stairs, PANS UP PAST his right hand, which methodically twists two meditation balls, TO REVEAL THE MOGADORIAN COMMANDER. He's the one who slaughtered Number 3 in Africa. His men part as he steps into view and crosses to Frank and Bret are chained to chairs. A Soldier stands behind each one. Frank looks at the Commander in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called you like I said. It's not my fault they got away! The Commander steps into the moonlight that seeps through window. We get our first good look at his face. A gnarled scar runs down his right cheek, identifying him as the sa Mogadorian Henri wounded in the escape from Lorien. His s is deathly pale and his eyes have a cold purple tint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did they go?
His accent is thick and his voice is unnerving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know? The kid had me pinned to the ceiling. The Commander turns to Bret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did they go? Bret is too freaked to even speak. The Commander nods to Soldiers. They grab Frank and Bret by the heads and yank open their mouths. Frank watches in confused terror as th Commander holds one of the meditation balls.

dialogues.speaker: DOZENS OF TINY RAZOR-BLADES
dialogues.text: suddenly flower open across its surface and viciously spi With cold-blooded calm, the Commander drops the ball into Frank's mouth. OFF its terrible DRILL-LIKE WHIR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vermillion clouds streak the heavens. Sam's truck pulls u next to Henri's SUV, which is inconspicuously parked in f of a 24-hour pharmacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll meet you back at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going back to Paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help, but you'll never see us again. Henri climbs out. Sam looks at John, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he serious? John nods, numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to tell people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Forget about us. We never existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Sam. OFF Sam as John climbs out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rundown dump on the bleak edge of a no-name town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John silently stews. BIKERS smoke at the edge of the grim pool which is drained for the winter and rattles with fro leaves. Henri steps out of the motel office with a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri lets John inside, chains the door and draws the sun bleached curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We leave at nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri, this is insane. They still don't know where we live. Henri seethes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only a matter of time. They know our faces. They saw Sam. How long has he known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Halloween. Henri is floored and hurt by the admission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you and you lied to me! John bows his head, can't meet Henri's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only because I knew how you'd react and I didn't want to leave Paradise. Henri paces, tries to quell his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we don't have a choice. The Mogs are using humans to trap us. From this point on -- no more towns. No more schools. We're going off the grid until we find the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. His tone is defiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a discussion. In a flash of pent-up anger, John holds up his hand and telekinetically sweeps Henri off his feet and pins him against the wall. Henri looks at him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving without saying goodbye to Sarah. Henri fixes him with a steel-edged stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let. Me. Down. Spent, John releases Henri who slides to the floor, shake The dynamics of their relationship forever changed. Henri finally stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your phone and IDs. John hands him his cell phone and wallet. Henri opens the back of the phone and pulls out the SIM card. SNAP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Smith dies today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTERS and LOOKIE-LOOS watch from behind the crime sce tape that crisscrosses the street. CAMERA ZEROES IN on THE TEEN GIRL. She's the one we saw in Nashville and who torched the sti house. Her eyes study the STREAM OF POLICE that hustles i and out of the house carrying evidence Baggies and equipm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CRIME SCENE PHOTOGRAPHER methodically catalogs the grim blood-soaked nightmare. He's in a full body suit and booties. The flashgun mounted to his camera whitewashes t space as a UNIFORM COP appears on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief wants to send the morgue boys in and seal this tomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope they haven't had lunch yet. These guys were gutted from the inside out. He steps over to Frank's body which has been splayed open As he flashes off some shots, the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: appears in the corner of his viewfinder. She's kneeling b Frank's severed head which has rolled a short distance fr the body. The Photographer pulls the camera away from his eye and looks at the Teen Girl, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? She ignores him. He glances at the only window which is 2 feet away on the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in? The Girl continues examining Frank's wounds. Totally unnerved, the Photographer shouts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we've got a live one down here. When he spins back, the Girl is gone, vanished into thin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A DIRT DEVIL as it snorts up beads of broken gla REVEAL SAM cleaning the evidence of the previous night's adventure. Cardboard covers the missing passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam climbs out of the truck and is startled by Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He tries to avoid eye contact, but she is determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened last night? I've tried calling him all day. But his number's no longer in service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about him, Sarah. Incredulous, she grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere until you tell me what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left with Henri and he isn't coming back. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. OFF Sarah, shattered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands under the steaming spray. Eyes screwed shut. Naked and lost. TWO LOUD KNOCKS at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taillights in five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GROUP OF BIKERS by the pool has grown four fold. They partying hard. Henri keeps his head down as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FEMALE CLERK stares at the TV mounted on the wall. Sh watching a local news report about the Warsaw house murde Henri enters. The window RATTLES as a motorcycle speeds p and he slides his key onto the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri steps in and is annoyed to hear the SHOWER still running. He strides to the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John? No answer. He KNOCKS. Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri shoulder-rams the door open. He whips back the show curtain and stares at the empty tub. JOHN IS GONE. OFF Henri's grim concern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is twilight blue. A gleaming Harley ROARS around bend, going full throttle. John is on its back. The wind whips his hair. Eyes set forward. Headed back to Paradise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie opens the front door and is surprised to find John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little late for dessert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here. Some friends dragged her to a party at Mark Jayne's. John absorbs this news, turns. Annie steps out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't usually pry into my daughter's love life, I certainly didn't want my mother in mine -- but Sarah's my youngest and she's special to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's special to me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big, two-story property dominates the end of a cul-de sac. TEENS stream up the drive. Cars are parked end to en down the street. CAMERA CRANES TO MEET John as he charges into view on the stolen motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC THROBS. John works his way through the throng of partying TEENS. He passes a RED-HAIRED TEEN BOY recording the event on a FlipVideo camera. A hand grips John's shoulder. John turns to find Mark Jayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to see you. John shoves him aside and heads for the sweeping stairs..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been transformed into a major makeout den. Candles l the windowsills and ring the edge of the pool table. TEEN COUPLES grope in the flickering half-light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody upstairs! Kevin's going for the beer bong record! The Teens immediately bolt for the stairs. In the giddy exodus, one of them accidentally brushes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: onto the white shag rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John heads down the burgundy hall which is lined with fam portraits. He glances in the rooms as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and her friend, EMILY, sit on the bed with Mark's t dogs, Abby and Dozer. A wedge of light cuts across them a the door opens and John steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John!
She leaps up and hugs him. John waits as Emily exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about last night. She pulls away, her relief turning to anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not good enough. Sam said you were never coming back. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't leave without seeing you one last time. She looks at him, crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's true. What's going on? What kind of trouble are you and your dad in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit! Whatever it is, I'll understand -- just tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is I'm not who you think I am. You need to forget about me. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you acting like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's the only way to keep you safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe from what? He turns away, shields her from his torment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Sarah. He doesn't look back as he walks out the door. CAMERA STA ON SARAH as she sinks onto the bed and the dogs comfort h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party-goers pack the hall and kitchen watching Kevin cons an impossible amount of beer through a funnel and hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink! Drink! Drink! Drained and numb, John heads the other way and fails to notice the smoke seeping from under the basement door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John strides down the driveway, bleak-faced. He's about t straddle the motorcycle when he hears a muffled EXPLOSION He looks back and sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: billowing from the side of the house. He bolts towards th front door, SCREAMS at a JOCK as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 911! As he races inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's total chaos. Smoke and FLAMES plume up from the basement. Terrified Teens scramble. John thrashes through the crowd, SHOUTING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panicked evacuation spills out. A window EXPLODES and orange flames lick the cold night air. John sees Emily stumble out clutching one of Mark's dogs, Abby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went back for Dozer. Another EXPLOSION rocks. A COUPLE of drunk Jocks CHEER. John looks back at the house. The fire has taken hold wit incredible speed. The living room curtains are ABLAZE.
cuts over the sound of the HISSING FLAMES. It's coming fr the second floor. John charges past Mark, towards the hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late. You can't get through! John ignores him and runs into the inferno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAMES sprint up the walls and clouds of black smoke spew from the sectional sofa. Immune to the heat, John heads i the front hall and finds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is fully engulfed. Fearless, he clambers up the flaming steps. His jeans and shirt catch fire. He's almost reache the top when the staircase BREAKS AWAY behind him and DISINTEGRATES in a cloud of embers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a raging conflagration. The family portraits blister the walls. John beelines towards Dozer's PLAINTIVE WAIL which reverberates over the UGLY ROAR of the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is crouched by the heavy oak bed that dominates the corner of the room, COUGHING, eyes burning from the smoke heat. Dozer is cowered underneath, HOWLING. Sarah desperately tries to move the bed but it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: CRAAAACK
dialogues.text: The door rips off its hinges. Through the smoky half-ligh Sarah watches as John strides into the room, heroically backlit by flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozer's under the bed. He's too scared to come out! John strides forward, grips the bed with one hand and effortlessly hoists it. Sarah looks at him, amazed, then scrambles forward and gently scoops Dozer into her arms. John puts the bed back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let go of him. I promise I won't let go of you.
As he lifts them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio heads into the hall just as an 8-foot section of floor collapses in front of them. Unfazed, John sprints forward and bridges the hole. ANGLE ON SARAH as she stares at the burning chasm in terr and grips Dozer tighter. John touches down on the other side and doesn't slow as h powers down the hall, which is a SHRIEKING tunnel of fire

dialogues.speaker: A BURNING BEAM
dialogues.text: breaks free and swings down in front of them. Sarah SCREA but watches in stunned amazement as John sweeps it out of way with a telekinetic flick of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second-floor window SHATTERS as John leaps out holdin Sarah and Dozer. A ROARING tongue of fire whips his back he drops to the ground and touches down with Sarah and Do COUGHING and shell-shocked, Sarah puts the dog down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? She stares at him, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked through that fire without getting burned. I saw you stop that beam. SIRENS wail in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll explain everything... but not here... (offering his hand) Sarah... please? As they take off into the woods, the IMAGE FREEZES, then REWINDS. John and Sarah kneel in the shadows, then FLY BACKWARDS up through the window and INTO the burning hous REVERSE TO REVEAL the Red-Haired Teen watching playback o his FlipVideo camera, amazed. He runs to the back of the house and finds Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out, man! PUSH IN as Mark stares at the footage, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Sarah walk in SILENCE, dappled in moonlight. He catches her staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't look at me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm still trying to process everything I saw and I keep coming to the same conclusion -- what you did isn't possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? (off his hesitation) For once please tell me the truth. It's the hardest thing he's ever had to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name isn't John. I don't have a name, just a number. 4. In fact, my whole life can be reduced to numbers: like 15 million -- that's how many light years it takes to get from my planet to Earth. 38 -- that's how many towns I've lived in. Or 3,671 -- that's how many days I've been running from an enemy that wants me dead. I lied to you, Sarah, because I lie to everyone. That's how I stay alive. Tears of relief brim as he finally reveals his soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't be telling you any of this. It's dangerous. Emotionally spent, John leans against a tree. She steps towards him and brushes her hand down his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. I just want to be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that too. But if I stay you could get hurt. I have to leave to keep you safe. Sarah absorbs the bitter reality, reaches for his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I want to give you first.

dialogues.speaker: A PHOTOGRAPH OF SARAH AND JOHN
dialogues.text: sharpens INTO FOCUS. It's the one Annie took of them at Thanksgiving. John and Sarah stand in the eerie red glow. She gently tongs the image into a bath of fixing solution

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll always remember me. With exquisite tenderness they kiss. John's palms shimmer The intensity of the luminescence builds with their risin passion. They sink to the floor and the light crescendos an ethereal flash that BLEACHES OUT THE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spinning lights of a trio of fire trucks FLARE THE LE CREWS hose down the last smoking embers. A DEPUTY approac Mark, who is standing by a police cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI showed up flashing their badges. Wanna talk to you. As he points to a black SUV that's parked down the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark climbs in the back. He looks around nervously as the vehicle starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? Is this about the fire? It was an accident.
Only now do we REVERSE TO REVEAL

dialogues.speaker: THE MOGADORIAN COMMANDER
dialogues.text: sitting in the back. His face is masked in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hunting for one of the guests at your party. He holds up a netbook which flashes with the FlipVideo footage of John's rescue of Sarah. It's posted on YouTube

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, John Smith. But I didn't invite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fugitive. We've been tracking him for some time. Mark smirks, vindicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you find him. He points to Sarah's image on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not at Sarah's, I already checked. And one of my dad's deputies drove by his house -- nada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He poses a great threat to us. Where else could he be? Mark pulls out his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Sarah's cell number, maybe you guys can trace it? The Commander takes the phone and passes it to one of his in the front. He looks back at Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me everything you know about John Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is at the kitchen counter, watching the YouTube video his laptop, when headlights bleed through the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps out and reacts in surprise as Henri emerges thr the headlight glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's not at the house. Is he here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but he's all over the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. He turns back to his SUV. Sam follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things from Warsaw -- they're coming, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back inside. This isn't your fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell it isn't. I'm coming with you. OFF this declaration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crystal pendant glints against John's chest as he gra âParadise Highâ sweatshirt from a supply closet and y on. Sarah's phone suddenly RINGS, startling them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. She listens, then hands John the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Henri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri careens through the night with Bernie and Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out now! At that moment, all the POWER in the school DIES and the headlights of an SUV flash across the window. Fear regist in John's eyes as he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late... they're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commander climbs out. Mark follows but is distracted a trio of black SUVs speeds into the lot followed by a tractor trailer from which inhuman GROWLS echo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's in there? He looks back at the Commander who is arming up from the trunk of the SUV. Mark glimpses the arsenal of future-tec machine pistols, double-bladed swords and heavy-duty dagg He backs away in fearful realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys aren't FBI. Before he can run, a Mogadorian Soldier grabs him by the and constrains him. The Commander pulls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: over his broad shoulders. The cartridges are made of crys and swirl with purple light. Finally, he slips on his trademark red coat and spins towards the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of John's hands holds Sarah's while the other lights their way as they hurtle down the passage. They've almost reached the doors when they suddenly fly open and
struts into view. We RECOGNIZE her as the mysterious Teen Girl. She swings up an awesome hand-cannon and FIRES righ at them. THE BLAST scorches the air between John and Sara but takes out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who was stalking up the hall behind them! John watches in shock as the Mogadorian keels over and SHATTERS into embe John swings back to the Teen Girl as she strides forward. SHE IS NUMBER 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughta keep your heroics off the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number 6. Where's your Cepan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his way. Where's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead. The Mogs got her four months ago. We had been tracking them. She heads past. John and Sarah follow after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We discovered they plan to attack Earth. The only thing standing in their way is the six of us. The revelation hits John like a wrecking ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what that means? John nods with new purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war starts tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First we have to get out of here alive and find the others. Six leads them past the impressive trophy case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we up against?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a commander, a bunch of soldiers and two Piken. They'll have all the main entrances covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym, there's a tunnel under the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take us out to the stadium. Six acknowledges that info with a curt nod. FOOTSTEPS. Si grabs John and Sarah by their arms and yanks them back against the wall. They hold their breath as one of the Mogadorian Soldiers prowls straight past. He stops for a moment, then turns t corner. Sarah looks across at the mirrored trophy case an sees there's no reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're invisible. John realizes, turns to Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any other Legacies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can control the elements. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lumen and telekinesis. More FOOTSTEPS. John turns and watches in horror as the Mogadorian Commander and a trio of Mogadorian Soldiers sw into view. The Commander is holding MARK. He is ashen with fear. Sarah has to catch herself from screaming. John makes a move, but Six holds him in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put. They want to draw you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not dying because of me!
ANGLE ON THE SOLDIERS AND MARK. They're heading past the trophy case when JOHN'S VOICE booms out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mark! Linoleum! Now! Mark rips free and hits the deck a second before the trop case EXPLODES. Shards of glass rip into the Mogadorians a trophies torpedo off the shelves and impale the aliens against the far wall. The Mogadorians SCREAM as they flai John, Sarah and Six break cover. John wrenches Mark to hi feet and they take off running. They dash around the next corner and find

dialogues.speaker: HENRI, SAM AND BERNIE
dialogues.text: sprinting towards them, followed by two Mogadorians! Six raises her hand-cannon, BLOWS one of the Mogs away, while John safely leads everybody into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barricade the doors! John telekinetically uproots a trio of bookcases that fly across the space and block the door. Sarah turns to Mark is totally shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said they were FBI. That John was a fugitive. What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've stumbled into a war. So shut up and keep your head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see age hasn't mellowed your attitude, 6. Mark turns to John, guilt-wracked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know they were trying to kill you. (genuine, to John) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't your fault -- it's mine. He offers Mark his hand. Mark shakes it. Suddenly, Bernie begins to GROWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, boy? Henri sees where Bernie is staring and realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's telling us to run! They take off a second before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUMMEL-RAMS through the wall in a shower of bricks, books paper. It utters a glass-shattering ROAR. John looks back and sees Bernie bravely holding his ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie! He watches as the beagle sprints forward and launches him at the monster. Bernie clamps onto the Piken's neck. He's hopelessly outmatched and holds on for dear life as the P tries to buck him off. Then something amazing happens -- BERNIE BEGINS TO MORPH. He doubles, triples in size and keeps growing. His featur become reptilian, gecko-like, his fur turns to spines and a matter of moments Bernie has transformed into a hulking ALIEN CREATURE. John looks to Henri as the truth of Bernie's origin dawns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie's a Chimera. He came with us from Lorien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I wasn't the only one keeping secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody had to watch you when I wasn't around. They exit while Bernie and the Piken continue to battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Henri catch up to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym's this way. A projectile HISSES past John's ear and DETONATES a row o lockers -- BOOOOOM! -- it's like an incendiary grenade. T paint blisters off the lockers as they are consumed by FI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees two Mogadorian Soldiers hauling heavy-duty weapons t use the glass cartridges that glow on their ammo belts. O FIRES another round. John telekinetically RIPS a door off its hinges. It flies forward, blocks the charge and IGNIT John spins back and SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go! They take off. John follows and uses his telekinesis to fling cabinets, doors, benches anything he can to block t fiery onslaught. But the rounds are coming too fast and a projectile SMACKS him in the back. It's like being hit by napalm. As FLAMES wash across him, he looks up and snaps

dialogues.speaker: THE SPRINKLER HEADS
dialogues.text: that run the length of the hall. A deluge sprays, dousing the fire. With his clothes smoking, John tears around the corner. The Mogadorians charge after him, but find SIX IS WAITING. BOOOOMM! BOOOOMM! She blasts them at point-blank range. Magenta light gushes from their wounds. Like rain hitting hot coals, their bodies HISS as they crack and cinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving! Henri, Mark, Sarah and Sam race out of view. Then John se something emerge through the smoky, water-choked haze.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S THE SECOND PIKEN
dialogues.text: It utters a low, predatory GROWL and launches itself forw Oddly, Six doesn't move. She closes her eyes and lays one hand on the flooded floor, turning the water to

In a matter of moments, the hall has been transformed int icy tunnel. The sprinklers spray snow. The Piken struggle to find purchase in this new frozen environment and slip- slides after John and Six, who disappear into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRAAAAACK! The doors are DEMOLISHED as the Piken flails o the ice. It takes out a row of tables and chairs and skid to a stop. It ROARS in humiliated FURY, and its red eyes scan for John and Six who are nowhere to be seen. The Piken prowls behind the serving counter. Snow beads o its back. Its monstrous nostrils suddenly flare, sensing something. It hunches lower and peers at the trays and pa that are stored below. REVEAL JOHN AND SIX. They're invisible. John clutches Six arm. They're lying between a stack of roasting dishes. Threads of foamy drool drip onto their faces as the Piken pokes its head further. Its ghoulish red eyes seem to sta right at them. With a final frustrated SNORT, it carries

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri, Sarah, Sam and Mark race into view. Sarah stops, panicked and afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right behind us. He offers her his hand. She's about to take it when

dialogues.speaker: A MOGADORIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: steps out of the shadows. There is nowhere and no time fo Henri and the others to run. But as the Mogadorian squeez the trigger of his hand-cannon, the wall on his right

dialogues.speaker: ERUPTS
dialogues.text: Bernie and the first Piken crash into the hall. They are still at each other's throats and don't even notice as th steam-roller over the Mogadorian, squashing him like a bu The creatures SMASH through the opposite wall and out of sight. It's over in a violent blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Six sneak through the shadows. She steps to the door, but it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've blocked it. Use your telekinesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not leaving without my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you mean the girl? John ignores the jibe and turns back. Six grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I broke the Elders' spell to find you. The Mogs can kill me now. We have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay and fight. OFF his determination...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri and Sam crouch behind one station while Sarah and M hide in the one opposite. Henri pulls a selection of weap from the backpack. He hands one to Sam, looks over at Mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to use one of these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's the sheriff. He slides two across the floor. The door opens. They swin up to fire but find -- John and Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for the Mogs. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie and the Piken pummel the rows of lockers which COLLAPSE like dominos. Gashed and exhausted, the battling duo SHATTER-SMASHES into THE SHOWER STALLS. Water SPURTS from a broken pipe. The Piken slips on the slick tiles. As it struggles to right itself, Bernie seiz the moment and sinks his fangs into the monster's neck.

desperately thrashes. Its talons viciously rip into Berni side. Ignoring the pain, Bernie doesn't let go until his finally jerks to stillness. As Bernie sinks to the floor, MORPHS back into a beagle and lies spent and bleeding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John leads the group past the bleachers and points to the side of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door's over here. The tunnel leads out to the stadium. Sarah sweeps back the curtain, revealing a padlocked set metal doors. John holds up his hand, snaps the lock and whips the chain free. The doors fly open,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spring out of the dark. One tackles Henri while the other blindsides John. Henri struggles until

dialogues.speaker: BOOOOOM
dialogues.text: The BLAST cinders the Mog's head clean off. Henri looks o and sees Mark holding a smoking shotgun and nods his than The second has John pinned when it suddenly ROARS in agon and disintegrates into a shower of sparks, revealing SIX. She sheathes her dagger and helps John up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving your life. My new hobby. Sarah notices a smile of respect flicker between John and Six. PHHHHHHT! PHHHHHHT! PHHHHHHT! -- three Mogadorian knives razor the air. One impales Six in the shoulder. Sh slumps at John's feet. Henri opens FIRE on the

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMANDER AND TWO MOGADORIAN SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: who storm towards them. John SCREAMS to Sam and Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her down the tunnel! They grab Six by the arms and drag her into the tunnel. Sarah glances back at John and follows after them. Henri takes out a Soldier. John sweeps up his hand and

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODEN FLOOR OPENS LIKE A ZIPPER
dialogues.text: The Commander and the other Soldier are sent flying as th planks rip free of their nails. John and Henri charge int the tunnel. The doors fly shut behind them and the bleach stand rolls forward to seal the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is in the lead. Sam and Mark follow, holding the wounded Six. They've almost reached the end when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lurches into the mouth of the tunnel. Without a second's hesitation, Sam swings up his gun and BLASTS it. Mark loo at him in shock as they race through the embers. Sam shru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I play a lot of Xbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Mark, Six and Sarah hurtle across the field. When th reach the track, Sarah looks back and smiles with relief John and Henri burst out of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop! Get to the woods! She nods and exits with the others. John and Henri head onto the field after them when

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND PIKEN
dialogues.text: leaps out of the mouth of the tunnel behind them. It's seriously pissed. It bounds straight towards John. Its fangs glint like barbed wire as it launches itself toward him. At the last second,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nobly shoves John out of the way and is plucked into the Piken's jaws. The creature shakes him like a rag doll and flings him 50 feet down the field. John watches, anguishe as Henri lands in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooooooooooooooooooooo! The Piken pivots, turns its crimson eyes on John. It almo seems to smirk. Its fangs are stained with Henri's blood. John's face hardens into a mask of rage.

He makes no attempt to flee as the Piken charges. As it springboards into the air... ANGLE ON JOHN'S HANDS -- as they suddenly clench. ANGLE ON THE GOALPOSTS -- as they're SNAPPED clean off th bases and fly skyward. ANGLE ON JOHN -- as the Piken's shadow washes across him. ANGLE ON THE PIKEN -- as it arcs towards John with its mo open and teeth bared. Suddenly, the goalposts spear its flanks, impaling it like supersize BBQ forks. The three-ton killing machine drops out of the sky and sm onto the 20-yard line. John watches impassively as the re life-fire dies in its eyes and its head lolls to one side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stadium looms in the distance. Sam wrenches the dagge from Six's shoulder while Sarah and Mark anxiously watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sinks by Henri's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henri. Henri GROANS as John cradles his head. His coat is soaked with blood and his torso is horribly mauled. John tries t drag him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, taillights in five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be coming with you this time. Save yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go together! Henri smiles, grateful, but at that moment

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMANDER'S SWORD
dialogues.text: flies past John and impales Henri in the chest. Henri utt a GROAN and his dying eyes meet John's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the others. His voice is a GRAVELLED WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life is my life... always. His eyes flutter closed and he slips from John's grip. Anguished, John doesn't notice his pendant momentarily flicker with a radiant blue light. He angrily spins to fa THE MOGADORIAN COMMANDER. But in a blur of speed, the Commander steps forward, wrap his hand around John's throat and plucks him into the air He's flanked by the remaining Soldiers. John's feet kick uselessly as he's lifted face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number 4. Three Loric pendants dangle from the Commander's belt lik mocking trophies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Cepan saved you on Lorien. The Commander's voice hisses with cruel certainty. He wrenches his sword from Henri's corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this moment was inevitable. The blade shimmers with silver flame as he raises it. John's eyes narrow as the sword sweeps towards him. This the moment his adolescence officially ends. This is the moment when a warrior is born. ANGLE ON BLADE as it SHATTERS into a million pieces, whic flutter to the ground like glittering confetti. John stares at the alien with calm confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is inevitable. ANGLE ON JOHN'S HAND AS IT IGNITES. The flame is hotter and brighter than 10,000 acetylene torches. He grips one of the Commander's bandoliers. TIGHT ON THE MOGADORIAN'S FACE as he realizes it's over. The glass cartridges detonate in a deadly chain reaction.
John, the Commander, the Mogadorian Soldiers, in fact eve goddamn thing in the stadium is obliterated in the

dialogues.speaker: SUPERNOVA OF FIRE
dialogues.text: that radiates across the field like a blinding ring of he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah looks back as the blistering vortex of flame lights night sky. Her breath catches in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... John. Before anyone can stop her, she takes off running, sprint for the stadium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a smoking ruin. The seats have melted into puddles. Sarah bursts into view. She looks across the devastated field. The grass has been reduced to a charred black carp of stubble. Nothing remains of Henri or the Mogadorians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! She charges across the broiled expanse, hoping against ho Then she sees John, lying motionless and naked, his cloth completely burned away. She stops, puts her hand to her mouth to stifle a sob, when he COUGHS and stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! Ash swirls like snow as she races to his side. They wrap each other in their arms. Neither wanting to ever let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is cracked with the first light of day. Sarah is dressing Six's wound at a table. Six winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Girl Scout first aid didn't cover extraterrestrial dagger wounds. Six smiles, grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

As the two teens size each other up, CAMERA FINDS Mark. H hangs up his cell and crosses to John and Sam, who are talking intently by the motorcycles. John is now wearing pair of old jeans and a faded denim jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff's Department is starting to put up roadblocks. You guys better get moving. Six and Sarah join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You good to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me. John nods to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, ride with Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need baggage. Sam steps in front of her, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to find out if the Mogs took my dad. Six turns to John, who is not bending, then glares at Sam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slow us down, I'll shoot you myself. Sarah looks at John, tries to rein in her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to come too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have died last night. I'm not putting you in danger again. Mark's promised to look after you.
Tears tumble down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come back for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it's safe. She bows her head, anguished. He gently lifts her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I'm from, we only give our heart to one person. I've given mine to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Sarah. Their lips meet and they kiss. It only ends when John hea an URGENT RUSTLE in the woods. They turn and watch as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: limps into view. Blood mats his fur and his face is scratched but he's alive. OFF John's relief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits behind Six on her motorcycle. John holds Bernie he straddles his Harley. Bernie morphs into a gecko and darts into his pocket. Sarah studies John and Six, unsure John THROTTLES the bike to life, then looks back at Sarah He fights a pang of jealousy when he sees her standing at Mark's side. RAIN spits as the motorcycles start off.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is the first town I've left without Henri. The first one I have a reason to come back to. John and Sarah hold each other's gaze, desperately trying brand the image of their faces onto their memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bikes blur past the âWelcome to Paradiseâ sign.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He warned me the pain would be unbearable if I left her. He was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A straight stretch of blacktop bisects the sunbaked flatn

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I don't regret it. The pain reminds me what's at stake. A dust trail plumes as the bikes power into view.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We must find the others and face our enemy together. I'm not sure how we can stop them. But nothing is inevitable. I know that now. Thunderheads darken the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am Number 4. His eyes are fearless and his face is undaunted by the battles yet to be fought. He's ready to face a future unmapped and uncharted. Ready. FADE OUT.
